name: Centro de Investigação e Intervenção Educativas
headAddress: Faculdade de Psicologia e de Ciências da Educação da Universidade do Porto, Rua Alfredo Allen, Porto, Portugal
goal:
CIIE is a research institution based at the Faculty of Psychology and Education Sciences of the University of Porto (FPCEUP). Since its inception, in 1988, CIIE has been funded by the Portuguese national research funding agency (FCT). CIIE develops high-quality and innovative research on key issues of educational and social change and processes, in order to broaden the role of education in promoting equity, inclusion and active citizenship. Fostering excellence and a highly relevant international profile, CIIE is committed to produce rigorous and significant contributions to knowledge, to promote research staff careers and advanced training, and to develop knowledge transfer, wide dissemination and outreach activities.
The focus is on increasing the Centre’s research capacity and performance, building on existing and emerging areas of research strength: evaluation and public policies in education; early school leaving, second chance education and lifelong learning; training, equity and the teaching profession; contemporary educational challenges for migrants and refugees; empowerment and inclusion through digital education and arts; citizenship, communication and literacy in health and well-being; higher education, innovation and diversity; community education, participation and social change; pedagogical management and democratic participation. It is favoured the development of research that demands t multidisciplinary approaches drawn on staff wide range competence in education and in complementary disciplines, including psychology, sociology, history, philosophy, etc., which facilitates tacking major societal challenges through innovative solutions.
CIIE hosts 54 PhD researchers, 40 PhD research students (with full time awarded grants), and other collaborator members, with extensive experience in collaborative research, at both national and international level.
The Centre contributes to the delivering of high-quality graduate and postgraduate programmes, backed up by excellent working environments and a solid grounding in research methodologies.

Other activities:
- A CIIE member chairs all the review panels in the assessment and accreditation of all degree programs (all cycles) in Education in the Portuguese HEIs
- CIIE and its members were invited/appointed by different national Ministries to assist: in the development of the National Research and Innovation Agenda on social inclusion and citizenship; contribute to the design of the Portuguese Citizenship Education Strategy; be the Portuguese representative at the Governing Board of the Centre for Educational Research and Innovation (CERI) of OECD; act as deputy coordinator coordinate an axis of Portugal INCoDe.2030 (Portuguese National Digital Competences Initiative e.2030) and also to coordinate an axis - inclusion; integrate as key consultants the National Curricular and Organisational Flexibility and Autonomy Program; chair the National Portuguese Inclusion Plan; chair the Portuguese Red Cross-Porto; act as external consultant of Azores Inclusion Plan...
- Members have been/are external experts and evaluators for institutions such as EACEA (EC), Erasmus+ and European Projects on Cross-Sectoral Refugees Programs; EC independent experts for European research (H2020 Marie Sklodowska-Curie, ERAnets as NORFACE, COST actions); British Academy/Leverhulme Small Research Grants; Carnegie Trust; Croatian Agency for Assessment of HE; Lithuanian Agency for Assessment of HE; Brazilian Council for Science and Technology (CNPq); Riksbankens Jubileumsfond (Sweden)...
